meanings.definition: The act of expunging or erasing something.
meanings.sent1: The expunctions of old files helped clear up space in the office.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer filed for expunctions of the outdated records.
meanings.sent3: The expunctions of the graffiti on the wall made the building look much cleaner.
meanings.sent4: Her art was like expunctions on a canvas, removing all traces of doubt.
meanings.sent5: The expunctions of the errors in the report were crucial for accuracy.

meanings.definition: The removal of something from a record or list.
meanings.sent1: The expunctions from the attendance list caused confusion.
meanings.sent2: The expunctions of the outdated data improved the database's efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The expunctions of the wrong answers from the quiz results were a relief.
meanings.sent4: His apology was like an expunctions of the hurtful words he had said.
meanings.sent5: The expunctions of the canceled items from the list saved time and effort.
